content:
Strength training is a crucial aspect of improving endurance. You can effectively target your core and legs with minimal equipment at home. Here are some exercises to get you started:

**Core Exercises:**

1. **Plank**: Hold a plank position for 30-60 seconds, rest for 30 seconds, and repeat for 3-5 sets. This exercise targets your abs, obliques, and lower back.
2. **Bodyweight Crunches**: Lie on your back with your knees bent and hands behind your head. Lift your shoulders off the ground, curling up towards your knees. Lower back down slowly and repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.
3. **Russian twists**: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground. Twist your torso to left and right, touching your hands to the ground each time. Repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.
4. **Leg raises**: Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight. Lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight, and hold for 1-2 seconds. Lower them back down slowly and repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.

**Leg Exercises:**

1. **Squats**: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands by your sides. Slowly lower your body down into a squat, keeping your back straight and knees behind your toes. Push back up to the starting position and repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.
2. **Lunges**: Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot. Lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your front knee behind your toes and back knee almost touching the ground. Push back up to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Do 10-15 reps per leg, 3-5 sets.
3. **Calf raises**: Stand on the edge of a stair or step with your heels hanging off the edge. Raise up onto your tiptoes and then lower back down slowly. Repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.
4. **Glute bridges**: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat. Lift your hips off the ground, squeezing your glutes at the top, and hold for 1-2 seconds. Lower back down slowly and repeat for 10-15 reps, 3-5 sets.

**Minimal Equipment Needed:**

* A yoga mat or exercise mat for comfort and grip
* A chair or bench for step-ups (optional)
* A resistance band or light dumbbells for added resistance (optional)

**Tips:**

* Start with lower reps and sets and gradually increase as you build strength and endurance.
* Focus on proper form and technique over the number of reps.
* Warm up before your workout with 5-10 minutes of light cardio and stretching.
* Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets and 60-90 seconds between exercises.
* Mix and match these exercises to create a circuit-style workout or focus on one or two exercises per day.

Remember to listen to your body and take rest days as needed. Consistency and patience are key to seeing improvements in your strength and endurance.
